channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: World's longest surviving conjoined twins worked carnival sideshow act die at the age of 68
item.description: Donnie and Ronnie Gaylon the world's oldest living conjoined twins died on July 4, 2020 at the age of 68 in Dayton,Ohio. The brothers spent their life performing as a sideshow act in carnivals.

item.title: Sydney could be plunged back into lockdown if disease spreads
item.description: Health Minister Brad Hazzard this morning said re-introducing restrictions is a 'possibility' if the virus spreads from Victoria into New South Wales.

item.title: Former MI6 spy's dossier sparks Huawei storm over 'useful idiots' claims
item.description: Among a string of incendiary claims, the dossier described the Chinese telecoms firm as 'Beijing's strategic asset'. Pictured: Alleged target Sir Kenneth Olisa with the Duchess of Cambridge.

item.title: Horrifying moment woman slams into patio shelter as she tries to jump from rooftop into a pool
item.description: A man and woman prepare to jump off the roof of a home and into a pool. The man succeeds but the woman hesitates and end up slamming into a shelter before splashing into the water.

item.title: Abandoned black Labrador found tied to railings in Kent, with note asking kennels to take him
item.description: The black Labrador was left attached by his collar to a mental gate outsideÂ Jasmil Kennels in Upchurch near Sittingbourne, Kent.

item.title: William and Harry agree to split Diana memorial fund
item.description: An agreement between the Royal Foundation of the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge and the now abandoned Sussex Royal Foundation was signed in December last year, financial documents show.

item.title: How long before babies are grown in ziplock bags?
item.description: JENNY KLEEMAN: The more we understand reproductive medicine, the more likely it is that full ectogenesis will become possible one day.

item.title: Russia threatens 'retaliatory measures' after UK sanctions
item.description: Russia has threatened to retaliate against the UK after Britain sanctioned 25 Russian officials as part of Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab's new sanction regime.

item.title: Kasabian star Tom Meighan is scheduled to appear in court on domestic assault charge
item.description: The 39-year old's abrupt departure from the group he helped form as a teenager was confirmed in a public statement released by his band-mates on Monday.

item.title: Team GB sprinter Bianca Williams says Cressida Dick must quit
item.description: Bianca Williams, 26, and her husband Ricardo dos Santos, 25, were hauled from their Mercedes and handcuffed in front of their three-month-old son in Lanhill Road, Maida Vale, on Saturday afternoon.

item.title: Indian-born billionaire started Boohoo at Manchester market
item.description: Before Boohoo shot onto the ever-growing fast fashion scene, its owner Mahmud Kamani, 55,Â ran a Manchester market stall. His sons Adam and Umar launched Pretty Little Thing in 2012.

item.title: Prince Charles plans to 'dampen' 'sense of royal entitlement'
item.description: Royal author Nigel Cawthorne has claimed that Prince Charles plans to 'dampen a sense of entitlement among royals' as he prepares to become king, He made the comments to The Express.

item.title: How can I avoid a knee replacement? DR MARTIN SCURR answers your health questionsÂ
item.description: DR MARTIN SCURR: Osteoarthritis begins with inflammation, and leads to the gradual loss of cushioning cartilage from the end of the bones that comprise the joint.

item.title: Sir Thomas Becket's 800-year-old shrine is digitally brought to life
item.description: The stunning CGI reconstruction of the shrine at Canterbury Cathedral uses new evidence to show how it would have appeared before its destruction almost 500 years ago.

item.title: Elaborate funeral rituals led to a rise in 'human art' 8,000 years ago
item.description: Archaeologists working in Jordan discovered a series of flint artefacts that look like stone tools - but they were never used and could have been funeral figurines.

item.title: Thousands of teens are at risk of slipping into a world of gangs and drugs due to lockdown
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of teenagers are in danger of becoming a 'lost generation' - slipping into lives of crime and idleness due to lockdown, says the Children's Commissioner Anne Longfield.

item.title: Green for go! Rishi Sunak's Â£3billion eco jobs boost with workers paid to plant trees
item.description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak has set aside Â£3billion for a green employment package focused on cutting emissions, improving the environment and creating jobs across Britain.

item.title: Meghan Markle left Kate Middleton 'upset' with 'rant' at staff
item.description: The Duchess of Sussex, 38, is 'very sensitive' about being 'number two' to Kate Middleton, 38, after joining 'alien environment' of The Firm, royal author Tom Quinn told the Daily Star Online.

item.title: People with English accents are more likely to get better customer service
item.description: First-time house buyers with a range of accents in Sheffield were asked to rate the service they received from estate agents. Women with Romanian accents were given the worst service.

item.title: Now more British women say they're victims of Jeffrey Epstein after the arrest of Ghislaine MaxwellÂ
item.description: US lawyer Gloria Allred, who represents 16 of the paedophile's victims, said a number of women from the UK had contacted her in recent days to make claims against Jeffrey Epstein's estate

item.title: Teen reveals she tested POSITIVE for COVID-19 the day after getting a nose job
item.description: TikTok user @lsdbebe opened up about the situation in a viral video, which has been viewed more than three million times since it was posted last week.

item.title: ANOTHER 'explosive' book hits the Trumps: Melania will be subject of tell-all by former best friend
item.description: Stephanie Winston Wolkoff, a close friend of Melania Trump and a former adviser to the East Wing, will release a memoir detailing her friendship with the first lady this fall.

item.title: RICHARD KAY: Prince Andrew's silence is ruinously damaging his mother
item.description: RICHARD KAY: Day after day, news of exasperating royal behaviour has thudded on to Britain's breakfast tables to the despair of the Queen. Every morning seems to bring news about Andrew.

item.title: Herd immunity to coronavirus may be 'unachievable' because 5% of people in Spain have antibodies
item.description: At least 60% of people need to have contracted coronavirus for it to not be able to spread throughout a community, but a new study has found that only 5% of people in Spain have antibodies.

item.title: Boris Johnson accuses care home bosses of failing to look after their residents during the pandemicÂ
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson provoked an angry dispute last night after he accused care homes of failing to look after their residents properly during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: British gymnasts who competed at Olympics and Commonwealth Games in abuse and bullying claims
item.description: Gymnastics champion Lisa Mason, who competed for Britain at the Sydney Olympics, is among those claiming she suffered abused, some of which she says occurred aged 10.

item.title: Woman loses job after attacking pubgoer for 'speaking Polish'
item.description: The alleged attacker today insisted she hadn't used those words and she revealed she had been sacked today from her job as a recruitment consultant after the footage went viral.

item.title: Superbugs pose a grave threat to Britain's cancer patients, experts fear
item.description: As many as 2,985 people in England died from antibiotic-resistant infections in 2018; and 60,788 patients were infected - a rise of nearly ten per cent over the previous year.

item.title: EDWARD LUCAS: At last! The end of the age of appeasing Beijing bulliesÂ
item.description: EDWARD LUCAS: China's plan for world domination faces a hitch. That is the upshot of our Government's impending decision to curb Huawei's role in our next-generation 5G mobile data network.

item.title: Hi-tech T-shirt packed with tiny sensors that can help diagnose the menopause
item.description: The garment is worn round the clock to measure changes in temperature and identify sweating caused by the hot flushes many menopausal women suffer.

item.title: Return of the drugged-up illegal raves that should make every parent shudder
item.description: Welcome to the illicit world of the UK's burgeoning quarantine rave culture - one of the ugliest and most disturbing by-products of the nation's 14-week coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: David Walliams' book publisher says 'racist' character is WHITE
item.description: HarperCollins responded by saying Jack Monroe's tweets were factually inaccurate. They said the character Monroe claims has 'racist undertones' because of her 'big frizzy hair' is actually white.

item.title: Can shining a light in your ear REALLY stop you feeling tired?
item.description: Can a supplement or gadget stop you feeling tired? Dr Najia Shaikh, an NHS GP based in London and at the One Skin Clinic in Harley Street, assessed products that claim to help to do just that.

item.title: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: There's nothing normal about the new normalÂ
item.description: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: My worry is that enforcement will remain inconsistent as restrictions are lifted. I warned you that the 'new normal' would be worse than lockdown. So it is proving.

item.title: Father of paramedic stabbed in the chest says attack was 'completely random'
item.description: Mother-of-three Deena Evans (pictured), 39, and a male colleague were stabbed while responding to a home in Wolverhampton.

item.title: Tory MP to cancel licence fee after BBC podcast on: 'How can white women not be Karens?'
item.description: Several MPs have slammed the BBC on social media for its No Country For Young Women podcast, where presenter Sadia Azmat asked: 'How can white women not be Karens?'

item.title: Pictured: Woman, 23, stabbed to death at Holiday Inn
item.description: Khloemae Loy, 23, was found dead atÂ the Holiday Inn on Bugsby's Way, Greenwich, in south-east London, shortly after 10am on Sunday.

item.title: Amanda Kloots thanks family after death of Nick Cordero
item.description: Amanda Kloots shared a heartfelt post thanking her family for supporting her as her husband Nick Cordero fought for his life in the hospital. He died Sunday from COVID-19 complications.

item.title: Three pubs are forced to close because customers test positive for coronavirus
item.description: The Lighthouse in Burnham-on-Sea, Somerset, the Fox & Hounds, in Batley, West Yorkshire and The Village Home in Alverstoke, Hampshire are the first pubs in England to close.

item.title: The best investment is now designer bags
item.description: Felicia Bromfield spoke to the women who save their hard-earned salaries to purchase handbags. Today, their growing collections contain items now worth up to 20 times the amount they paid.

item.title: Brent Cross floods as water main bursts on North Circular Road
item.description: A burst water main has flooded a carriageway on the North Circular leaving many drivers trapped in their cars.

item.title: Leading authors urge Booker Prize bosses to reinstate Baroness Nicholson
item.description: Tory peer Baroness Nicholson allegedly 'misgendered' transgender model Munroe Bergdorf and was axed from her Booker role. But a group of authors say they are 'dismayed' at the decision.

item.title: Did fiancÃ© who killed millionaire children's author Helen Bailey murder his first wife too?
item.description: Ian Stewart, rhe fiance who killed children's author Helen Bailey, appeared in court yesterday accused of previously murdering his wife. At the time it was recorded as 'death by epilepsy'.

item.title: Apple files patent for tech that verifies identity without passport
item.description: Apple may be working on technology that lets users store their identification on an iPhone that could be shared with other systems, eliminating the need for passports or driver's licenses.

item.title: Meghan Markle is the 'center of Prince Harry's world' says body language expert
item.description: Body language expert Blanca Cobb told DailyMail.com that the vide call shows that Harry supports Meghan and she shows vulnerability to 'a man she loves and trusts.'

item.title: Kanye West shares photo of his shelters in progress as part of his '2020 vision'
item.description: The rapper shocked the world by announcing last week that he was running for president. On Sunday, he tweeted a photo of his 'shelter', writing: 'YZY SHLTRS in process #2020VISION'.

item.title: Disney actor Sebastian Athie who starred in O11CE dies at 24
item.description: Disney actor Sebastian Athie died at the age of 24 over the weekend. The star, who was born in Mexico, was best known for playing Lorenzo Guevara on the Argentine TV series O11CE.

item.title: Johnny Depp and Amber Heard lawyers seek to avoid confrontation
item.description: Lawyers for the warring former couple have been working to make sure they arrive at the High Court at separate times for the showdown to ensure there is no risk of them bumping into one another outside.

item.title: Three quarters of people who live with a coronavirus sufferer may develop 'silent' immunity
item.description: The number who have suffered Covid-19 may have been hugely underestimated because tests are looking for specific antibodies in blood rather than the body's 'memory' T cells.

item.title: Help us crown your NHS hero as explorer Robin Hanbury-Tenison, 83, salutes team who saved his lifeÂ
item.description: Never has there been a time when this campaign is so important. Over the next four weeks, we're asking you to nominate NHS workers who've gone out of their way to care.

item.title: Long Lost Family: Adopted grandmother breaks down in tears after visiting late father's grave
item.description: Kathleen Fraser Jackson, 63, from Wembley, north west London, was put up for adoption at just three-months-old. She appeared on Long Lost Family tonight to discover more about her father's side.

item.title: Lord Clement-Jones 'baffled' by fake Huawei campaign revelation
item.description: Lord Clement-Jones, a Liberal Democrat, was allegedly targeted in a covert bid to invite British politicians and business leaders to take part in staged radio interviews and email them fake news.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell moved from New Hampshire to New York jail
item.description: The 58-year-old was arrested on Thursday at a home she recently purchased in rural New Hampshire. She is now in the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn.

item.title: Bubba Wallace accuses Donald Trump of 'hate' after comments
item.description: Bubba Wallace accused President Donald Trump of 'hate' toward him and said he would respond to that with 'love.' 'Always deal with the hate being thrown at you with LOVE!,' he tweeted.

item.title: Pregnant woman poses with thousands of BEES on her stomach
item.description: Bethany Karulak-Baker, a beekeeper from Steamboat Springs, Colorado,, posted for the shocking maternity shoot. 'We just dumped the bees on me and they naturally began to beard,' she said.

item.title: Rise in online sports betting has negative effect on young men
item.description: While online sports gambling sites have struggled to make up lost revenue during COVID-19, new research shows the industry could be having a negative impact on the lives of young men.

item.title: 4-inch tall dinosaur relative roamed Madagascar 200m+ years ago
item.description: The tiny lizard was unearthed on Madagascar and is a 'missing link' in the history of vertebrates, sayÂ the team from the North Carolina Museum of Natural Sciences.

item.title: Holidaymakers must wait for refunds as flights cancelled
item.description: A number of easyJet customers are complaining that only one leg of their journey has been cancelled, meaning they cannot go on their holidays away from Britain but still have active bookings.

item.title: Broadway show Hamilton faces calls to be 'canceled'
item.description: Alexander Hamilton advocated against slavery several times during his life, but often side-lined the issue in order to win the approval of wealthy or powerful benefactors and advance himself.

item.title: Ofcom could throw Chinese TV station off air over show trial
item.description: British broadcasting watchdog Ofcom today revealed it was considering sanctions following complaints of two news reports on the case of Peter Humphrey in China on CCTV news.

item.title: Photo of golden-crowned flying fox bat scares social media
item.description: While the picture, taken in the Philippines, appears to show a 'human-size' horror hanging upside down from a roof, it is actually a clever camera trick.

item.title: Man who organised Anni Dewani murder freed after HALF sentenceÂ
item.description: Zola Tongo, a taxi driver, who was jailed for 18 years for his part in the murder of Anni Derwani in South Africa in 2010, is to walk free from jail on July 28 after serving just over half of his sentence.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's 'secret stash of Jeffrey Epstein sex tapes'
item.description: Ghislaine Maxwell, 58, has a secret stash of Jeffrey Epstein's twisted sex tapes, a former friend exclusively revealed to DailyMail.com.

item.title: David Starkey apologises for `so many damn blacksÂ´ comment
item.description: The historian and presenter, 75, made the comments during an online interview with Brexit campaigner Darren Grimes for YouTube channel Reasoned UK.

item.title: Iran nuclear site suffered 'significant' damage in accident
item.description: Iran confirmed that the Natanz nuclear enrichment facility, located around 200 miles south of Tehran, was significantly damaged following a mysterious incident on Thursday morning.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Contact tracing app 'urgent' say NHS chiefs
item.description: Baroness Dido Harding and Simon Thompson appeared in front of members of the UK's House of Lords today and said a contact tracing app will work faster than human tracers can.

item.title: Earth's magnetic field changes 10 times faster than thought
item.description: UK scientists have simulated theÂ swirling flow of iron 1,740 miles below the planet's surface, which creates the electric currents that power the field, going back 100,000 years.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle join video call on equal rights
item.description: The Duke of Sussex, 35, made the comment as he joined wife Meghan Markle, 38, for a video call with young leaders from the Queen's Commonwealth Trust last week.

item.title: Homo erectus could run distances but 'built like rugby player'
item.description: Researchers from the Natural History Museum examined the ribcage of the famous Homo erectus skeleton Turkana Boy to better understand the species breathing.

item.title: African asylum-seeker stabbed to death at Greek migrant camp
item.description: The fight was with a rival Afghan group that left three Africans with knife wounds and one beaten with a club, local police said. One of the three with knife wounds was the young victim who died.

item.title: Lily James heads back to Hollywood star Chris Evans' hotel after glam night out together in London
item.description: English rose Downton Abbey star Lily James has been pictured enjoying a night out in London with Captain America star Chris Evans.

item.title: Drinkers queue over an hour as Scotland pub beer gardens reopen
item.description: Outdoor spaces in pubs and restaurants are now able to open for the first time as part of easing measures in Scotland.

item.title: Twitter users reflect on the things they'll miss about lockdown
item.description: Twitter users from across the UK and US have been using the hashtag #ThingsIWillMissAboutLockdown to share the positive parts of the coronavirus pandemic that will be missed.

item.title: Man, 30, with PTSD killed himself as he couldn't rejoin military
item.description: Jamie Davis was so 'riddled with guilt' about the deaths and injuries of fellow soldiers he screamed military call signs including 'foxtrot' and 'mandown' in his sleep.

item.title: Virgin Media crashes AGAIN; thousands lose internet access
item.description: Virgin Media tells MailOnline the issue was local to Nottingham and has now been resolved, however, customers are still claiming to have difficulty getting online.

item.title: Kate Garraway shares thanks as husband emerges from coma
item.description: Kate Garraway has made a rare appearance on social media to share her gratitude for the support she has received, since revealing her husband Derek Draper has awoken from his coma.

item.title: Make-up artists share contouring tip for slimmer nose with FORK
item.description: TikTok user Ellie Trimarchi, from Sydney, amazed the video sharing app with her simple hack for contouring your nose with a fork, using the prongs as a guide when applying the darker and lighter shades.

item.title: Housebuilders Barratt to repay all their furlough money
item.description: Barratt Developments furloughed 6,700 employees, 85 per cent of the builder's workforce, and topped up their salaries leaving them with Â£27 million to pay back to the government.

item.title: Sisters killed in London park found 'entwined' on the ground
item.description: Danyal Hussein, 18, allegedly stabbed Nicole Smallman, 27, and Bibaa Henry, 46, multiple times in the early hours of Saturday June 6Â in an 'unprovoked and random attack'.

item.title: Cyclists targeted during lockdown with logs and 'nail traps'
item.description: Tom Hayden was leading a group of ten cyclists through Epping Forest when two people walking their dogs allegedly dragged logs into the path.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 15 new fatalities in preliminary death toll
item.description: Department of Health data shows the rolling seven-day average of Covid-19 fatalities in the UK has now dropped to 95 - 20 per cent lower than the 117 for last Monday.

item.title: Yoko Ono, 87, 'still sharp' but 'slowing' and needs 24-hour care
item.description: Since 2017 Yoko Ono, 87, has often been seen outside in wheelchairs but she now rarely leaves her nine-room apartment in The Dakota, New York City.

item.title: Police launch probe into fashion giant Boohoo's Leicester factory
item.description: Priti Patel has stepped in and instructed the National Crime Agency to probe the issues amid claims the factories wereÂ operating without social distancing measures in place.

item.title: Ferrari LOSES legal battle to trademark the shape of 250 GTO
item.description: Ferrari had the shape of the svelte racer trademarked, but the Italian company has lost the right following a legal battle against a bespoke car manufacturer from the same city of Modena.

item.title: Romanian woman runs for life after posing with BEAR for photo
item.description: A woman in BacÄu, Romania, fled in terror as a bear she tried to pose next to for a picture lunged at her. The woman in white and blue managed to escape unharmed.

item.title: Mother who tandem fed her twoÂ daughters and still breastfeeds her daughter, 4
item.description: Natasha Keane, 38, from Galway, practises natural stage weaning - where a child decides for themselves when to stop breastfeeding and is still feeding four-year-old Grace.

item.title: Ex-MP Charlie Elphicke chanted 'I'm a naughty Tory' as he chased 'horrified' woman around his home
item.description: Former Conservative MP Charlie Elphicke is alleged to have pursued the woman after trying to kiss her at his home in 2007, Southwark Crown Court heard.

item.title: Crime gang suspects appear in court after EncroChat busted
item.description: Begin Pupla, 35, Mohammed Sabek, 33, and Philemon Ghezzehey, 35, appeared in Westminster Magistrates' court on Friday. Sabek blew a kiss to his sister as he was taken to the cells.

item.title: 'Hero' neighbour rescues little boy, three, stuck on his house roofÂ after climbing out of window
item.description: Landing Bojang, 30, leaped into action when he spotted the little boy, wearing just a T-shirt, climbing out of an upstairs window onto a bay roof of a house in south London on July 3.

item.title: Woman, 32, fell to death from French theme park rollercoaster
item.description: Elodie Duval, who was at the Parc Saint-Paul theme park near Beauvais for her son Allen's second birthday,Â slipped over the safety bar of a Formula 1 ride on Saturday.

item.title: PG Tips will remove all plastic packaging from its products by next year
item.description: The bags are made from corn starch and were first introduced on a limited range of products in 2018, but this latest move will see all PG Tips teas use these bags.

item.title: Happily married couples say sometimes it's GOOD to go to bed angry
item.description: People from around the world took to Twitter to share their tips after writer Jenna Baker, from Texas, asked for submissions in a post marking her own first anniversary.

item.title: Locals slam visitors as caravans arrive at Cornish beauty spots
item.description: Locals in Devon and Cornwall are so enraged by the visitors they have hung a sign up telling visitors to 'f*** off.' (pictured)

item.title: Newborn baby pictured clasping contraceptive coil mother used in failed bid to stop pregnancy
item.description: A baby in Vietnam was pictured holding onto the contraceptive coil that failed to stop his mother becoming pregnant, only moments after being born in Hai Phong.

item.title: Algae is turning snow on the Italian Alps pink
item.description: Snow on the Italian Alps is turning pink due to an algae known as Ancylonema nordenskioeldii that absorbs sunlight and increases the risk of ice melting.

item.title: Woman, 29, with incredible 52.8-inch legs says she loves showing them off
item.description: Rentsenkhorloo 'Ren' Bud, who was born in Mongolia, has some of the longest legs in the world and loves to show them off, but admits she's had trouble finding clothes and shoes that fit in Chicago.

item.title: Woman describes painful withdrawal from eczema medication
item.description: Anita Wong, 36, from Auckland, had to go through a painful withdrawal that took years, after being horrified by the affect of steroids when one eye was permanently damaged.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN: Just when you thought 2020 couldn't get any worse - along comes Kanye West
item.description: It was hard to imagine how 2020 could deteriorate any further in America. Then Kanye West stepped forward to metaphorically cry 'HOLD MY BEER, 2020!' and announce he is running for president.

item.title: Genes that raise the risk of dying from Covid-19 'were inherited from NEANDERTHALS'
item.description: Researchers from Germany and Sweden said a genetic sequence which entered the human bloodline through cross-breeding appears to have 'tragic consequences' for people with Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus England: Most children to be removed from shielding
item.description: Dr Jenny Harries, deputy chief medical officer for England, has said children are at 'low risk' from Covid-19 and almost all of them should be able to return to school after the summer.

item.title: Woman, 24, stoned to death in Pakistan 'honour killing'
item.description: The body of a 24-year-old woman has been found after she was stoned to death in an honour killing in Pakistan. Her husband Allah Baksh and his brother were arrested and remain in police custody.

item.title: Daniel Ricciardo defends six F1 drivers who chose not to kneel before Austrian Grand Prix
item.description: Ferrari's Charles LeClerc, Red Bull's Max Verstappen and 2007 world champion Kimi Raikkonen, were among six who refused to take a knee, moments before the season opening Austrian Grand Prix.

item.title: Jeremy Corbyn's son 'terrorised by violent lookalike of his dad'
item.description: Tommy Corbyn said police arrested a man in March after a swastika was daubed on the window of his CBD shop in Finsbury Park, North London .

item.title: Hyena is ripped to pieces by a lionÂ in photos from South Africa
item.description: Extraordinary photos taken in South Africa shows a lion capturing a 144lb hyena before ripping it apart. Photographer Chad Cocking, 36, captured the images while stood only 80 yards away.

item.title: One in five 18th century Londoners caught syphilis, study reveals
item.description: Researchers from the University of Cambridge painstakingly scoured hospital admissions to calculate the rate of syphilis infection for men and women up to the age of 35.

item.title: Billionaire Christian Candy plans basement for Â£150m complex
item.description: Christian Candy also plans to add a Â£30million mansion containing an 82-foot swimming pool, gym and massage room to his Â£150million estate in Surrey.

item.title: China accuses UK of 'gross interference' over Hong Kong
item.description: Boris Johnson announced the citizenship move last week after China pressed ahead with imposing a controversial national security law on Hong Kong.

item.title: Unruly Chinese tourist beats a sleeping baby seal with a slipper 'to wake up the animal'
item.description: Footage shows a man shouting 'wake up, wake up' and repeatedly hitting the brown fur seal's head and body while a woman is heard laughing as the mammal desperately runs towards the sea.

item.title: Wi-Fi signals can be hacked by criminals to tell when people are home or not, experts warn
item.description: Internet-connected security cameras that track potential burglars, such as Google'sÂ Nest Cam and Amazon's Ring range, can be interfered with by attackers.

item.title: Terrifying moment footballer is blasted by lightning bolt that hit his necklace
item.description: A video shows the moment a Russian footballer, 16, is hit by lightning as he kicks a ball into an empty net. Ivan Zaborsky was struck in Orekhovo-Zuevo, near Moscow.

item.title: Composer Ennio Morricone who wrote the music for The Good, The Bad And The Ugly dies aged 91Â
item.description: Ennio Morricone, whose scores for movies such as 'The Good, the Bad and the Ugly' made him one of the world's most famous and prolific screen composers, has died aged 91.

item.title: Chinese city issues epidemic warnings for the PLAGUE
item.description: Bubonic plague, known as the 'Black Death' in the Middle Ages, is one of the most devastating diseases in history, having killed around 100million people. The new case was found in Inner Mongolia.

item.title: Head teacher admits murdering wife and her company director lover in New Year's Day double killing
item.description: Rhys Hancock, 40, admitted at Derby Crown Court this morning murdering both his ex wife Helen, 39, and her new partner Martin Griffiths in the horrific double killing on New Year's Day

item.title: Millions of British families 'can't afford to eat healthily'
item.description: The way Britain produces, manufactures, sells and consumes food is a barrier to healthy eating, a report published by the House of Lords Food, Poverty, Health and Environment Committee warned.
item.media:description: A report said the way Britain produces, manufactures, sells and consumes food is a barrier to healthy eating (PA)

item.title: County lines gangs disguised young drugs mules as nurses and Deliveroo workers
item.description: Liverpool drug barons masterminded a scheme where young runners would disguise as essential workers to smuggle hard drugs without arousing suspicion.

item.title: Fashion giant Boohoo agrees deal to buy collapsed chains Oasis and Warehouse for Â£5.25 million
item.description: The Manchester-based group agreed the deal with restructuring expert Hilco Capital, which bought the Oasis and Warehouse brands and stock after the businesses were placed into administration in April.

item.title: Pretty Little Thing founder sells his stake to his father's firm Boohoo for up to Â£324million
item.description: Mahmud Kamani snapped up the remaining 34 per cent of shares from his son Umar Kamani, pictured with girlfriend Nada Adelle in Dubai, for an initial Â£269.8m today.
